diagrams.description: Business Administration represents the interconnected disciplines of managing modern organizations. It branches into strategic areas: operations management optimizes production processes, human resources develops talent, marketing creates customer value, finance allocates capital, and information systems enable data-driven decisions. Each branch supports organizational success through specialized expertise while maintaining alignment with overall business goals.
